p:
The enormous benefit of local containment of a pandemic virus strain can be realised only when (i) antiviral drugs are effective enough to reduce the reproduction number from its initial value of
to a value below 1, and (ii) timely distribution of antiviral drugs to appropriate individuals is possible in practice. In retrospect, pandemic H1N1 influenza in 2009 seemed to satisfy condition (i), but condition (ii) was not realised. We now consider some possible reasons for the failure to distribute antiviral drugs effectively.
